data.title: Compaq names Chris A. Davis to board of directors
data.meta_description: Compaq Computer has appointed Chris Davis, VP of General Dynamics, to its board of directors. Davis is also the executive VP and chief financial and administrative officer of Gulfstream Aerospace.
data.text:
Compaq Computer Corporation today announced that Chris A. Davis has been named to the company`s Board of Directors. Davis is Executive Vice President and Chief Financial & Administrative Officer of Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of General Dynamics Corporation. She also is a Vice President of General Dynamics.

"Chris Davis brings tremendous management expertise and financial acumen to Compaq," said Benjamin M. Rosen, Compaq Chairman of the Board. "Her extensive financial experience and background - at both Gulfstream Aerospace and GE - will be valuable assets to Compaq."

Davis joined Gulfstream in 1993 as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Along with Ted Forstmann, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and Bill Boisture, President and Chief Operating Officer, she was one of the three corporate officers comprising the Office of the Chief Executive. She also was a member of Gulfstream`s Board of Directors (formerly NYSE:GAC) until the Company was acquired by General Dynamics in 1999. She currently is a member of the Board of Directors of Wolverine Tube, Inc., which is headquartered in Huntsville, Alabama.

In 1996, Davis was selected as one of "The 50 Most Wanted in Finance" by Global Finance magazine and in 1997, she was named one of the "Top 25 Managers of the Year" by Business Week magazine. CFO magazine recently recognized her with its "CFO Excellence Award" in the Revenue Growth category for 1999.

Davis began her financial management career with General Electric Corporation in 1976. After completing GE`s Financial Management Training Program in 1978, she held numerous managerial assignments with increasing levels of responsibility. In 1984, she was named Manager of Financial Analysis for GE Aerospace`s Military and Data Systems Operation and two years later was named Manager of Financial Planning and Analysis for GE Aerospace. In 1988, she was promoted to Vice President of Finance for GE Communications and Services - Government Services Division. Davis became Chief Financial Officer for GE`s Electronic Systems Division in 1990. Davis earned a Bachelor`s Degree in Finance and a Master`s Degree in Finance and Statistics from the University of Florida.

Also today, Compaq announced that Frank P. Doyle will retire from the Board of Directors in April. Doyle, former executive vice president of General Electric Company and Director of Digital Equipment, has served on Compaq`s board since August 1998. "Frank Doyle has served Compaq and the company`s shareholders with distinction," said Rosen. "Frank has been a source of astute advice and practical wisdom."

Other members of Compaq`s board of directors include Benjamin M. Rosen, Chairman of the board of Compaq Computer Corporation; Michael D. Capellas, President and CEO of Compaq Computer Corporation; Lawrence T. Babbio, Jr., President and COO, Network Group, and Chairman, Global Wireless Group, Bell Atlantic Corporation; Dr. Judith L. Craven, former President of the United Way of the Texas Gulf Coast; Robert Ted Enloe, III, Managing General Partner, Balquita Partners, Ltd.; George H. Heilmeier, Chairman Emeritus of Bell Communications Research Inc. (Bellcore); Peter N. Larson, Chairman and Chief Executive, Brunswick Corporation; Kenneth L. Lay, Chairman and CEO of Enron Corp.; Thomas J. Perkins, General Partner, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, L.P.; Kenneth Roman, former Chairman and CEO of The Ogilvy Group; and Lucille S. Salhany, President and CEO, JH Media Limited.
